intro: Tarenna pangasinensis, commonly known as the Philippine tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or greenish-white flowers that are clustered in cymes. The fruit is a small, spherical berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
